\w Uzziah|strong="H1931"\w* \w was|strong="H1931"\w* \w the|strong="H7725"\w* \w one|strong="H1931"\w* \w who|strong="H1931"\w* \w rebuilt|strong="H1129"\w* Eloth \f + \fr 26:2 \ft Eloth is a variant of Elath; see LXX, 2 Kings 14:22, and 2 Kings 16:6.\f* \w and|strong="H3063"\w* \w restored|strong="H7725"\w* \w it|strong="H1931"\w* \w to|strong="H7725"\w* \w Judah|strong="H3063"\w* after \w King|strong="H4428"\w* Amaziah \f + \fr 26:2 \ft Literally after the king\f* \w rested|strong="H7901"\w* \w with|strong="H5973"\w* \w his|strong="H7725"\w* fathers.

\w But|strong="H3068"\w* \w when|strong="H5704"\w* Uzziah grew powerful, \w his|strong="H3068"\w* arrogance \w led|strong="H3068"\w* \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w his|strong="H3068"\w* own \w destruction|strong="H7843"\w*. \w He|strong="H5704"\w* \w was|strong="H3068"\w* \w unfaithful|strong="H4603"\w* \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w his|strong="H3068"\w* \w God|strong="H3068"\w*, \w for|strong="H5704"\w* \w he|strong="H5704"\w* \w entered|strong="H5704"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w temple|strong="H1964"\w* \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w LORD|strong="H3068"\w* \w to|strong="H5704"\w* \w burn|strong="H6999"\w* \w incense|strong="H7004"\w* \w on|strong="H5921"\w* \w the|strong="H5921"\w* \w altar|strong="H4196"\w* \w of|strong="H3068"\w* \w incense|strong="H7004"\w*.
